abstract.text: A view controller that provides an interface to a person so they can select and connect a continuity device to the system.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The view controller presents an interface on an Apple TV that lets a person choose a nearby continuity device (
). Your app can then connect to that device’s cameras and microphones (see
The continuity device picker presents any devices near the Apple TV that use the same Apple ID.
To respond to the various outcome events from the picker, your app needs to implement the
and assign it to the picker’s
SwiftUI apps can present the same interface with the

abstract.text: Create user interfaces for media playback, complete with transport controls, chapter navigation, picture-in-picture support, and display of subtitles and closed captions.
A view controller that proposes content to watch next.
A view controller that provides an interface to a person so they can select and connect a continuity device to the system.
The delegate that responds to events from the continuity device picker view controller.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the system supports connecting to a continuity device.
An interface that responds to events from a continuity device picker view controller.
A tvOS management object that controls whether a TV switches modes to match the video’s native mode.
A time range in an audiovisual presentation for content with an interstitial designation, such as advertisements or legal notices.
A set of markers for navigating playback of an audiovisual presentation.
A view controller that displays content from a player and presents a native user interface to control playback.
A protocol that defines the methods to implement to respond to player view controller events.
Adopt the latest features of the redesigned tvOS player user interface to provide a more streamlined way to watch your content.
Display a preview of an upcoming media item at the conclusion of the currently playing media item.
Present navigation markers in the Chapters panel to help users quickly navigate your content.
Capture high-quality photos, video, and audio in your Apple TV app by connecting
an iPhone or iPad as a continuity device.

doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKi.title: Supporting Continuity Camera in your tvOS app

abstract.text: Present additional content alongside your main media presentation using HTTP Live Streaming support.
Add interactive overlays, parental controls, and livestream channel flipping using a player view controller.

doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKi.title: Working with Overlays and Parental Controls in tvOS

abstract.text: Information about the capabilities of the port and the hardware channels it supports.
An object that represents a hardware or virtual capture device like a camera or microphone.
A class that represents a physical iOS device that’s nearby and can provide access to its cameras and microphones.
An object that manages a view hierarchy for your UIKit app.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The interface an app extension uses to respond to a request from a host app.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
An interface that provides a source for shareable content to fulfill user requests to share current content.
A protocol that a class must adopt to allow appearance customization using the [`UIAppearance`](doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIAppearance) API.
A set of methods for adapting the contents of your view controllers to size and trait changes.
A set of methods that define the focus behavior for a branch of the view hierarchy.
A set of standard methods that apps can adopt to support editing.
Methods for adding objects to your state restoration archives.
A set of methods that makes the iOS interface environment available to your app.
The protocol you adopt to restore an object’s state from a user activity.
A type that calls your code in reaction to changes in the trait environment.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
